com.brightcove.player.media

Class MediaService

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.brightcove.player.event.AbstractComponent
      • com.brightcove.player.media.MediaService
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Component

    @Emits(events="error")
@ListensFor(events={"findVideo","findPlaylist"})
public class MediaService
extends AbstractComponent
    Media Service is a Component that provides interaction with Brightcove's Media API by responding to Events that are sent by the given EventEmitter. Currently the MediaService only supports the following Media API commands:
    • find_video_by_id
    • find_video_by_reference_id
    • find_playlist_by_id
    • find_playlist_by_reference_id

    • Constructor Detail

      • MediaService

        public MediaService(EventEmitter eventEmitter,
            java.lang.String readToken)
        Initializes the MediaService with the given EventEmitter and the necessary Media API Read Access token. Note, this token should have URL access as well.
        Parameters:
        eventEmitter - the EventEmitter through which this MediaService will interact
        readToken - the Media API Read token with URL access

      • MediaService

        public MediaService(EventEmitter eventEmitter,
            java.lang.String readToken,
            java.lang.String queryBaseURL)
        Initializes the MediaService with the given EventEmitter and the necessary Media API Read Access token. Note, this token should have URL access as well.
        Parameters:
        eventEmitter - the EventEmitter through which this MediaService will interact
        readToken - the Media API Read token with URL access
        queryBaseURL - the base URL for the Media API.

    • Method Detail

      • buildVideoFromJSON

        public static Video buildVideoFromJSON(org.json.JSONObject json,
                       EventEmitter eventEmitter,
                       java.util.List<java.lang.String> errors)
                                throws org.json.JSONException,
                                       java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Builds a fully populated Video object from any values available in the given JSONObject structure. Note that no validation for any assumed or required fields is performed.
        Parameters:
        json - the JSONObject representing a single Video (from the Media API)
        Returns:
        a Video object with any recognized values from the given JSONObject
        Throws:
        org.json.JSONException
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
